definition: Xinhua (the official Chinese news agency)
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)
magnificent/splendid/flowery
old variant of 花[hua1]/flower
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua
abbr. for China
Xinhua News Agency
Xinhua News Network
Xinhua Bookstore, China's largest bookstore chain
Xinhua Daily newspaper
Xinhua District/Xinhua District of Shijiazhuang City 石家莊市|石家庄市[Shi2 jia1 zhuang1 Shi4], Hebei/Xinhua District of Cangzhou City 滄州市|沧州市[Cang1 zhou1 Shi4], Hebei

sentences.english: The attacker was identified by the state-run Xinhua news agency as Wu Huanming, 48.
sentences.chinese: 中国新华社确认了该袭击者名为吴焕明，四十八岁。

sentences.english: We went to the Xinhua Bookstore to buy books at two o'clock in the afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 下午两点我们去新华书店去买书。

sentences.english: In this regard, Xinhua Finance Department issued a short commentary credit rating a dissenting opinion.
sentences.chinese: 对此，新华财经资信评级部门发表短评提出不同意见。

sentences.english: It told the news agency Xinhua the ministry still enjoys strong government support.
sentences.chinese: 大公对新华社说，铁道部依然享有政府的强有力支持。

sentences.english: The agency's headquarters is located in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 新华社总社设在中国首都北京。

sentences.english: The city government has allocated money to help the schools cover the cost ofthe installation, state-run Xinhua news agency reported.
sentences.chinese: 新华社报道，市政府已经拨款帮忙学校支付安装费用。

sentences.english: He bough a book on basketball tactics from the Xinghua book-store yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天他在新华书店买了一本《篮球战术》。

sentences.english: A Xinhua correspondent in Taipei said strong tremor could be felt at around 2:11 am there.
sentences.chinese: 新华社驻台记者称2时05分在台北有震感。

sentences.english: On the cultivation of the consciousness of basketball in its drills of techniques and tactics;
sentences.chinese: 昨天他在新华书店买了一本《篮球战术》。

sentences.english: No accidents had been reported at the Tunlan mine in the past decade, Xinhua said.
sentences.chinese: 过去十年中，屯兰煤矿都没有发生过事故，新华社称。

sentences.english: April 20th. The first march organized by the Beijing University Student Union Preparation Committee, protesting the violent acts of the army and police the night before at the gate of Xinhua Men.
sentences.chinese: 组织的第一次游行，抗议昨夜军警在新华门的暴行。

sentences.english: Turn left at the library. Go straight down Xinhua Street.
sentences.chinese: 在图书馆向右转，沿着新华大街一直走。

sentences.english: Zhai, the professor quoted by Xinhua, said he knows Wang and Cai's paper.
sentences.chinese: 新华社援引翟教授说法，他知道王和蔡的文章。

sentences.english: Xinhua says offenders should be sternly punished.
sentences.chinese: 新华社说，犯事者应该严惩。

sentences.english: The mine has a reputation for safety because no accident had occurred there for a five years, Xinhua said.
sentences.chinese: 新华社报道说该煤矿拥有5年无事故的安全记录。

sentences.english: The Chinese navy's first aircraft carrier has begun its sea trials, the state-run Xinhua news agency has said.
sentences.chinese: 中国新华社称，中国海军首艘航空母舰已经开始试航。

definition: Xinhua Bookstore, China's largest bookstore chain
Yuhua District of Shijiazhuang City 石家莊市|石家庄市[Shi2 jia1 zhuang1 Shi4], Hebei

Xinmin county level city in Shenyang 瀋陽|沈阳, Liaoning

Mt Tai 泰山 and Mt Hua 華山|华山/another name for Mt Hua
Bank of China (BoC)
Hong Kong and Shanghai Banking Corporation (HSBC)
Tiexi district of Siping city 四平市, Jilin/Tiexi district of Shenyang city 瀋陽市|沈阳市, Liaoning
Industrial and Commercial Bank of China
a reading group/press (i.e. publishing house)
Tiedong district of Siping city 四平市, Jilin
Tesco, UK-based supermarket chain
South Central China (Henan, Hubei, Hunan, Guangdong, Guangxi, Hainan)/abbr. for China-South Africa
Carrefour, French supermarket chain
